intro: Radlkoferella sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globular sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent, fleshy leaves and specialized adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, and its growth form is typically low-growing and mat-like. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland desert regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
